Issues.Title: Route data is not updated when upstream parameters change, reopen: #15677
Issues.Body:
**Bug**
There is a real problem with unexpected behavior of a route with a children modules and view state component caching.
I will reopen this issue again. Please look at this problem here: [#15677](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/15677)

**Explanation**
Suppose we have some modules like listed below:

┌ Parent module   (e.g. exists some data resolvers for every child path)
├ Child module 1
├ Child module 2

**Unexpected behavior**
1. **Action**: navigate from the parent to the child path. (**parent -> child**)
    **Effect**: Route is changed. Resolvers works fine. Data is changed. Component view is updated.
2. **Action**: navigate from the child to the parent path. (**child -> parent**)
    **Effect**: Route is changed. Resolvers works fine. Data is changed. Component view is updated.
3. **Action**: navigate between children modules(the same parent module for both). (**child <-> child**)
    **Effect**: Route is changed. Resolvers works fine. Data is changed. **But** component view state **is the same** (old state).


**Expected behavior**
Component view should be updated when we navigate between children of the same parent module, because route is changed.

```
Angular CLI: 9.1.4
Node: 12.13.1
OS: linux x64

Angular: 9.1.4
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, localize, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.901.4
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.901.4
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.901.4
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.901.4
@angular-devkit/core              9.1.4
@angular-devkit/schematics        9.1.4
@angular/cdk                      9.2.2
@angular/material                 9.2.2
@ngtools/webpack                  9.1.4
@schematics/angular               9.1.4
@schematics/update                0.901.4
rxjs                              6.5.5
typescript                        3.8.3
webpack                           4.42.0
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Route data is not updated when upstream parameters change, reopen: #15677" (#37365)

Issues.Body:
🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑

Hi Team,
              I am working in the mono repo project which is consist of many angular projects and angular custom libraries. These are all depends on the config values from the shell application. We are getting the config values by using appinitializer factory method. In shell application, we have some imports of custom libraries in which we need to pass the config values. My doubt is like before the appinitializer loads all the submodules in the shell application are getting loaded and throws an error as config values are undefined in the submodules. Can you please suggest how to pass config values to the submodules if we need to get the config values dynamically. 

**shell application app.module.ts imports:**
`  imports: [
    BrowserModule,
    BrowserAnimationsModule,
    SecurityModule.forRoot(environment.securityConfig),
    CoreModule.forRoot(environment),
    AppStateModule,
    CMTRoutingModule,
    CmtStateModule.forRoot(environment),`

**Instead of environment we have to pass config values dynamically**

Thanks in advance.

🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑🛑

Issues.Body:

so ngcc should only add such maps if the original typings file
contains inline source-maps.

Issues.Title: Setting __Zone_disable_ZoneAwarePromise to true throws error
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package zone.js ### Is this a regression? I tried with angular 8 on stackblitz and it also throws Error. ### Description Setting `__Zone_disable_ZoneAwarePromise = true;` should disable zonejs patching of Promise.then. Instead, it throws `Promise has beed overwritten` error and stops. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction Just add `__Zone_disable_ZoneAwarePromise = true;` to index.html as per [documentation](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/zone.js/MODULE.md). https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-bazsff ## 🔥 Exception or Error 

Error: Zone.js has detected that ZoneAwarePromise `(window|global).Promise` has been overwritten.
from [packages/zone.js/lib/zone.ts::assertZonePatched](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/zone.js/lib/zone.ts#L726). ## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 9.1.6
Node: 10.15.3
OS: linux x64

Angular: 9.1.7
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, platform-server
... router, upgrade
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.901.6
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.901.6
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.901.6
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.901.6
@angular-devkit/core              9.1.6
@angular-devkit/schematics        9.1.6
@angular/cdk                      9.2.1
@angular/cli                      9.1.6
@ngtools/webpack                  9.1.6
@nguniversal/builders             9.1.1
@nguniversal/common               9.1.1
@nguniversal/express-engine       9.1.1
@schematics/angular               9.1.6
@schematics/update                0.901.6
rxjs                              6.5.5
typescript                        3.8.3
webpack                           4.42.0

zone.js: 0.10.3
**Anything else relevant?** Polyfills.js states that only 3 variables have affect: - __Zone_disable_requestAnimationFrame - __Zone_disable_on_property - __zone_symbol__UNPATCHED_EVENTS If this is true, than maybe you only need to fix zonejs documentation, because it mentions a lot of other flags, __Zone_disable_ZoneAwarePromise being one of them.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Setting __Zone_disable_ZoneAwarePromise to true throws error" (#37349)

Issues.Title: feat(dev-infra): ensure that merge tooling always loads latest config
Issues.Body:
Ensures that when the merge script runs, the commit being loaded is
the same commit as upstream/master.  If it is not the same commit,
it checks out the latest from upstream/master and reloads the config.

Issues.Title: ERROR in The Angular Compiler requires TypeScript >=3.6.4 and <3.9.0 but 3.9.3 was found instead
Issues.Body: ### **Description** I just upgraded to Angular/cli 9.1.7 and some other packages also using `ng update` Old packags.json ``` "dependencies": { "@angular/animations": "^9.1.7", "@angular/common": "^9.1.7", "@angular/compiler": "^9.1.7", "@angular/core": "^9.1.7", "@angular/forms": "^9.1.7", "@angular/platform-browser": "^9.1.7", "@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "^9.1.7", "@angular/router": "^9.1.7", "moment": "^2.25.3", }, "devDependencies": { "@angular/cli": "^9.1.6", "@angular/compiler-cli": "^9.1.7", "@angular/language-service": "^9.1.7", "@types/node": "^12.12.39", "karma": "^5.0.8", "typescript": "^3.7.5" } ``` new package.json ``` "dependencies": { "@angular/animations": "^9.1.9", "@angular/common": "^9.1.9", "@angular/compiler": "^9.1.9", "@angular/core": "^9.1.9", "@angular/forms": "^9.1.9", "@angular/platform-browser": "^9.1.9", "@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "^9.1.9", "@angular/router": "^9.1.9", "moment": "^2.26.0", }, "devDependencies": { "@angular/cli": "^9.1.7", "@angular/compiler-cli": "^9.1.9", "@angular/language-service": "^9.1.9", "@types/node": "^12.12.42", "karma": "^5.0.9", "typescript": "^3.9.3" } ``` Now when I run `ng s`, I get an error, **`ERROR in The Angular Compiler requires TypeScript >=3.6.4 and <3.9.0 but 3.9.3 was found instead`** **Why did Angular update me to Typescript 3.9.3 if it's not supported?** Error SS Now i have updated all the other packages and downgrade typescript to old version but still its showing me to update ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43669644/83221936-da6c8c00-a194-11ea-888a-d70d8ba875b9.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ERROR in The Angular Compiler requires TypeScript >=3.6.4 and <3.9.0 but 3.9.3 was found instead" (#37342)

Issues.Title: [i18n] Extract with personal library
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package `@angular-devkit` i18n extract or `ng-packagr` or another one. ### Description I have a library in a Nx repo builded with `ng-packgr` and a project that is using that library. The library is building well, and with `enableIvy` to `false` when i'm publishing, and it's working in the project when i'm serving, building and building prod mode. But when i'm trying to extract i18n, i have this following error. It appears that this error occurs on the `async` pipe in the library and I don't know why but the Type is not well detected or I don't understand the error. When I put the type `any` on the problematics `Observable` that ares async piped in the `html` everything is working fine. ```typescript cities$: Observable; => cities$: Observable | any; addresses$: Observable; => addresses$: Observable | any; isMobile$: Observable; => isMobile$: Observable | any; isTabletPortrait$: Observable; => isTabletPortrait$: Observable | any; isSticky$: Observable; => citiesisSticky: Observable | any; ``` ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction It's difficult to provide a reproduction because my library is in a private npm registry behind a VPN, and our project is private but i'm trying to explain everything. But i put the problematics components in Stackblitz anyway ;) https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-extract-bug ## 🔥 Exception or Error 
ERROR in node_modules/@wizbii/angular-ui/wizbii-angular-ui.d.ts.WzbHeaderComponent.html(5,3): No overload matches this call.
  The last overload gave the following error.
    Argument of type ‘Observable’ is not assignable to parameter of type ‘Promise’.
node_modules/@wizbii/angular-ui/wizbii-angular-ui.d.ts.WzbHeaderComponent.html(5,3): No overload matches this call.
  The last overload gave the following error.
    Argument of type ‘Observable’ is not assignable to parameter of type ‘Promise’.
      Type ‘Observable’ is missing the following properties from type ‘Promise’: then, catch, [Symbol.toStringTag], finally
node_modules/@wizbii/angular-ui/wizbii-angular-ui.d.ts.WzbHeaderComponent.html(6,3): No overload matches this call.

Issues.Title: fix(platform-server): correctly handle absolute relative URLs
Issues.Body:
Previously, we would simply prepend any relative URL with the HREF
for the current route (pulled from document.location). However,
this does not correctly account for the leading slash URLs that
would otherwise be parsed correctly in the browser, or the
presence of a base HREF in the DOM.

Therefore, we use the built-in URL implementation for NodeJS,
which implements the WHATWG standard that's used in the browser.
We also pull the base HREF from the DOM, falling back on the full
HREF as the browser would, to form the correct request URL.

Fixes #37314

Issues.Title: New default route config proposal
Issues.Body:
# 🚀 Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ✍️edit: -->
```
- [x] new
- [x] generate
- [x] add
```

### Description
Right now when you create an application with routing, it creates an AppRoutingModule. This is an extra NgModule that doesn't do anything (it doesn't change the injector config, and it isn't used for compilation of any templates).


### Describe the solution you'd like
Remove it and just export the route config directly.

https://github.com/StephenFluin/new-routeconfig-proposal/commit/558c655bdc3c440d10b98fc0749c28d4f3665e24

### Describe alternatives you've considered
We could also do this 100% in the AppModule, or export const ROUTECONFIG = RouterModule.forRoot(...) to get the same providers without the extra wrapper.

Issues.Title: Angular 9 assets not updating
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package This issue is (I think) caused by @angular/compiler (v9.1.9). ### Is this a regression? In Angular 8 and older this functionality did work. ### Description A few days ago I upgraded my project to Angular 9. Everything seemed fine, but as soon as I started changing JSON files in my assets folder (assets/api/test.json) I noticed a problem. Webpack registers the change I make to the file, but the old file is still served. Say I add a record to the JSON file `{ "foo": "bar" }`, the compiler sees the change and starts compiling. After that the webpage is refreshed (like expected), but the JSON file is not updated, the previous version is still served. In order to check if my project was the problem I created a new, empty, CLI project (Angular CLI 9.0.4). I am having the same issue here. It is not even picking up any now JSON files I add to the assets folder. It does add them in the build folder on a production build, but the files are missing on `serve`. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction See [this minimal reproduction](https://github.com/RobinvanTienhoven/test-asset-loading). Change a line in the `assets/api/test.json`. Angular will update the app, but the http call will still return a 404 not found on the file. ## 🔥 Exception or Error No error code ## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:**

# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: .... ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... Building on aot with the new arrow functions to import lazy loading modules seems breaking the lazy loading and main.js contains all of them. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction Just create a new project with the last angular-cli version (9.1.7) and implements a lazy loading module with arrow function type importing. ## 🔥 Exception or Error Build stats using arrow functions: ![100805853_3230499480313869_7761146830338916352_o](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18414951/83326109-900d0d00-a271-11ea-9153-ab8045926484.jpg) Build stats using # style import: ![100825619_3235026263194524_805670628471341056_o](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18414951/83326120-a1eeb000-a271-11ea-85d0-7348746a7a43.jpg) ## 🌍 Your Environment 



Angular CLI: 9.1.7
Node: 10.16.3
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 9.1.9
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... platform-server, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

-----------------------------------------------------------

@schematics/angular               8.3.26
@schematics/update                0.901.7
rxjs                              6.5.5
typescript                        3.7.5
webpack                           4.42.0
**Anything else relevant?** Here my build production configuration: ``` "production": { "fileReplacements": [ { "replace": "src/environments/environment.ts", "with": "src/environments/environment.prod.ts" } ], "optimization": true, "outputHashing": "none", "sourceMap": false, "extractCss": true, "namedChunks": true, "aot": true, "extractLicenses": true, "vendorChunk": false, "buildOptimizer": true, "budgets": [ { "type": "initial", "maximumWarning": "5mb", "maximumError": "20mb" } ] }, ```

| [copy-webpack-plugin](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin) | devDependencies | major | [`5.1.1` -> `6.0.1`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/copy-webpack-plugin/5.1.1/6.0.1) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin</summary>

### [`v6.0.1`](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​601-httpsgithubcomwebpack-contribcopy-webpack-plugincomparev600v601-2020-05-16)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/compare/v6.0.0...v6.0.1)

### [`v6.0.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​600-httpsgithubcomwebpack-contribcopy-webpack-plugincomparev511v600-2020-05-15)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/compare/v5.1.1...v6.0.0)

##### ⚠ BREAKING CHANGES

-   minimum supported Node.js version is `10.13`, 
-   the plugin now accepts an object, you should change `new CopyPlugin(patterns, options)` to `new CopyPlugin({ patterns, options })`
-   migrate on `compilation.additionalAssets` hook
-   the `ignore` option was removed in favor `globOptions.ignore`
-   the `test` option was removed in favor the `transformPath` option
-   the `cache` option was renamed to the `cacheTransform` option, `cacheTransform` option should have only `directory` and `keys` properties when it is an object
-   global `context` and `ignore` options were removed in favor `patten.context` and `pattern.globOptions.ignore` options
-   the missing file error is now an error, before it was a warning
-   the `from` option now can only be a string, if you use `{ from: { glob: 'directory/**', dot: false } }` changed it to `{ from: 'directory/**', globOptions: { dot: false } }`
-   the `copyUnmodified` was removed without replacements
-   the `2` version of `webpack-dev-server` is not supported anymore
-   the `logLevel` was removed in favor the `infrastructureLogging.level` option, please read the [documentation](https://webpack.js.org/configuration/other-options/#infrastructurelogginglevel)

##### Features

-   implement the `concurrency` option ([#​466](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/issues/466)) ([c176d7d](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/commit/c176d7d124cf3c5ad372576d4b0f7fbf5e1d0afc))
-   implement the `directory` option for the `cacheTransform` option ([29254e3](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/commit/29254e394cb695d89b477f44f3a3bf8c99c74ca7))
-   implement the `noErrorOnMissing` option ([#​475](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/issues/475)) ([e3803ce](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/commit/e3803ceffe93361184efc9b799be4c9dfb4eb467))
-   migrate on webpack built-in logger ([#​446](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/issues/446)) ([5af02bc](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/commit/5af02bcfc716b6bca96b569740a45221a974ae61))

##### Bug Fixes

-   asset size ([197b0d8](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/commit/197b0d8d08e6ce976f645dade7641cfdcfc0781d))
-   persist assets between rebuilds ([57f3e61](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/commit/57f3e618108c3a6c1f61f21186d69433ee51a561))

##### [5.1.1](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/compare/v5.1.0...v5.1.1) (2019-12-12)

##### Bug Fixes

-   allow to setup empty array ([#​425](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/issues/425)) ([3b79595](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/commit/3b79595d6ef3527a26588112ad17e3c54e264d5c))

</details>

Issues.Title: Enforce functions return type in libraries
Issues.Body:
# 🚀 Feature request

### Command
- [x] generate library

### Description
By default, it is not required to explicitly type functions' return value, as TypeScript can always infer the type based on the function code.

But the inference assumes that the function's code is correct. If the code change or is incorrect, the return type inference will reflect that.

While it is acceptable in applications, as it will raise an error where the function is used if the types do not match anymore, it is more dangerous in a library, as the functions are not used directly. It can lead to unwanted breaking changes in the public API.

### Describe the solution you'd like
TSLint has a rule to enforce functions' return type (and ESLint too, for the future migration):
```json
{
  "rules": {
    "typedef": [true, "call-signature"]
  }
}
```

It could be added when doing `ng g library`.

It is an easy change as:
- it won't impact applications: libraries already have a specific `tslint.json` due to `--prefix` option
- it won't impact already created libraries as it only happens when generating a new one

This is a really easy thing to add, I can take care of the PR if Angular team signal is green.

If it is considered a too big step, it could be added only if the workspace is already using TypeScript `strict` mode (following the new `--strict` option in Angular >= 9). But I think as we are talking about libraries, it should really be the default: libraries authors must be stricter to avoid compatibility issues (`strict` mode should even be the default for libraries, but it would be another discussion).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Enforce functions return type in libraries" (#17821)

<details>
<summary>sass/dart-sass</summary>

### [`v1.26.7`](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​1267)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass/compare/1.26.5...1.26.6)

##### JavaScript API

-   Add `sass.NULL`, `sass.TRUE`, and `sass.FALSE` constants to match Node Sass's
    API.

-   If a custom Node importer returns both `file` and `contents`, don't attempt to

| [copy-webpack-plugin](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin) | dependencies | major | [`5.1.1` -> `6.0.1`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/copy-webpack-plugin/5.1.1/6.0.1) |
| [copy-webpack-plugin](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin) | devDependencies | major | [`5.1.1` -> `6.0.1`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/copy-webpack-plugin/5.1.1/6.0.1) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin</summary>

### [`v6.0.1`](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​601-httpsgithubcomwebpack-contribcopy-webpack-plugincomparev600v601-2020-05-16)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/compare/v6.0.0...v6.0.1)

### [`v6.0.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​600-httpsgithubcomwebpack-contribcopy-webpack-plugincomparev511v600-2020-05-15)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/compare/v5.1.1...v6.0.0)

##### ⚠ BREAKING CHANGES

-   minimum supported Node.js version is `10.13`, 
-   the plugin now accepts an object, you should change `new CopyPlugin(patterns, options)` to `new CopyPlugin({ patterns, options })`
-   migrate on `compilation.additionalAssets` hook
-   the `ignore` option was removed in favor `globOptions.ignore`
-   the `test` option was removed in favor the `transformPath` option
-   the `cache` option was renamed to the `cacheTransform` option, `cacheTransform` option should have only `directory` and `keys` properties when it is an object
-   global `context` and `ignore` options were removed in favor `patten.context` and `pattern.globOptions.ignore` options
-   the missing file error is now an error, before it was a warning
-   the `from` option now can only be a string, if you use `{ from: { glob: 'directory/**', dot: false } }` changed it to `{ from: 'directory/**', globOptions: { dot: false } }`
-   the `copyUnmodified` was removed without replacements
-   the `2` version of `webpack-dev-server` is not supported anymore
-   the `logLevel` was removed in favor the `infrastructureLogging.level` option, please read the [documentation](https://webpack.js.org/configuration/other-options/#infrastructurelogginglevel)

##### Features

-   implement the `concurrency` option ([#​466](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/issues/466)) ([c176d7d](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/commit/c176d7d124cf3c5ad372576d4b0f7fbf5e1d0afc))
-   implement the `directory` option for the `cacheTransform` option ([29254e3](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/commit/29254e394cb695d89b477f44f3a3bf8c99c74ca7))
-   implement the `noErrorOnMissing` option ([#​475](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/issues/475)) ([e3803ce](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/commit/e3803ceffe93361184efc9b799be4c9dfb4eb467))
-   migrate on webpack built-in logger ([#​446](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/issues/446)) ([5af02bc](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/commit/5af02bcfc716b6bca96b569740a45221a974ae61))

##### Bug Fixes

-   asset size ([197b0d8](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/commit/197b0d8d08e6ce976f645dade7641cfdcfc0781d))
-   persist assets between rebuilds ([57f3e61](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/commit/57f3e618108c3a6c1f61f21186d69433ee51a561))

##### [5.1.1](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/compare/v5.1.0...v5.1.1) (2019-12-12)

##### Bug Fixes

-   allow to setup empty array ([#​425](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/issues/425)) ([3b79595](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/commit/3b79595d6ef3527a26588112ad17e3c54e264d5c))

</details>

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>rollup/rollup</summary>

### [`v2.11.2`](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​2112)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/compare/v2.11.1...v2.11.2)

_2020-05-28_

##### Bug Fixes

-   Include side-effects in the second argument of `Array.from` ([#​3604](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3604))

##### Pull Requests

-   [#​3604](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3604): Mark `Array.from` as side-effectful, use two-argument Array.from when mapping Sets ([@​lukastaegert](https://togithub.com/lukastaegert))

### [`v2.11.1`](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​2111)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/compare/v2.11.0...v2.11.1)

_2020-05-28_

##### Bug Fixes

-   Also include side-effects in files that are marked as side-effect-free if they contain an included default export that is reexported ([#​3602](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3602))

##### Pull Requests

-   [#​3602](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3602): Handle side-effects next to side-effect-free default exports in case the default export is reexported ([@​lukastaegert](https://togithub.com/lukastaegert))

### [`v2.11.0`](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​2110)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/compare/v2.10.9...v2.11.0)

_2020-05-27_

##### Features

-   Add basic support for optional chaining ([#​3582](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3582))
-   Provide a normalized set of options with proper default values to `buildStart` and `renderStart` ([#​3597](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3597))
-   Do not count adding properties to the prototype of an unused class as a side-effect ([#​3598](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3598))
-   Support providing `null` for empty setters in SystemJS via option ([#​3592](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3592))

##### Bug Fixes

-   Do not fail when using a `/*#__PURE__*/` annotation inside a class field ([#​3599](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3599))
-   Allow using `--watch` and `--treeshake` together with sub-options such as `--watch.clearScreen` on the command line ([#​3597](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3597))

##### Pull Requests

-   [#​3582](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3582): Support optional chaining via acorn fork([@​guybedford](https://togithub.com/guybedford))
-   [#​3592](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3592): System format optional setters([@​guybedford](https://togithub.com/guybedford))
-   [#​3597](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3597): Provide normalized options ([@​lukastaegert](https://togithub.com/lukastaegert))
-   [#​3598](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3598): Treeshake prototype modifications in classes ([@​lukastaegert](https://togithub.com/lukastaegert))
-   [#​3599](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3599): Retain pure annotations in class fields ([@​lukastaegert](https://togithub.com/lukastaegert))
-   [#​3601](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3601): Fix white-space in docs ([@​tu4mo](https://togithub.com/tu4mo))

</details>

-   the plugin now accepts an object, you should change `new CopyPlugin(patterns, options)` to `new CopyPlugin({ patterns, options })`

Issues.Title: Angular 9/Ivy + i18n: Empty main.js.map when built in watch mode
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by Ivy. ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: Angular 8 ### Description In Angular 9 when building a localized bundle in watch mode with, e.g., `ng build --configuration=de --watch` the created main.js.map SourceMap is just an empty object. Not sure if this is a bug or just a missing feature, but I couldn't find any documentation about it. When Ivy is disabled in tsconfig.json the SourceMap is built as expected. The problem also doesn't occur with `ng serve`. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction See https://github.com/mkemmerling/angular9_i18n_build_watch This is just a minimal 'repro-app' with i18n configuration as described in the Angular docs. To reproduce the error run `ng build --configuration=de --watch` and inspect the empty main.js.map SourceMap in dist/repro-app/de. ## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 9.0.1
Node: 13.8.0
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 9.0.0
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, localize, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.900.1
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.900.1
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.900.1
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.900.1
@angular-devkit/core              9.0.1
@angular-devkit/schematics        9.0.1
@angular/cli                      9.0.1
@ngtools/webpack                  9.0.1
@schematics/angular               9.0.1
@schematics/update                0.900.1
rxjs                              6.5.4
typescript                        3.7.5
webpack                           4.41.2
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular 9/Ivy + i18n: Empty main.js.map when built in watch mode" (#17803)

Issues.Body:
## I'm submitting a... 

[ ] Regression (a behavior that used to work and stopped working in a new release)
[x ] Bug report  
[ ] Performance issue
[ ] Feature request
[ ] Documentation issue or request

## Current behavior When I had updated Angular to latest version (6.1.4) and then try to run it by "npm start" I was receiving > ERROR in Could not resolve module /D/Work/lumyslinski/app_projects/project_c > Failed to compile The path was shortened without telling what module is missing. ## Expected behavior It should tell me what module is missing. ## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions Create new angular app in the path that has got more than 106 characters. ## What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior? ## Environment 

Angular version: 6.1.4


Browser:
- [x ] Chrome (desktop) version 68.0.3440.106
- [ ] Chrome (Android) version XX
- [ ] Chrome (iOS) version XX
- [ ] Firefox version XX
- [ ] Safari (desktop) version XX
- [ ] Safari (iOS) version XX
- [ ] IE version XX
- [ ] Edge version XX
 
For Tooling issues:
- Node version: 6.3.0
- Platform:  Windows 10 / Ubuntu 18.04
Solution: If You put the ClientApp to the root path like D:\ClientApp everything is working ok. See attached print screen. ![screen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/764448/44311119-ec2ad800-a3e1-11e8-9447-f72e2ba1cecb.jpg) I guess that some module do not like quite long paths...

Issues.Title: I've been using the `ng build my-lib --watch` for some time now but I 've been unhappy  with the rebuild time.
Issues.Body:
I've been using the `ng build my-lib --watch` for some time now but I 've been unhappy  with the rebuild time.
Today I changed the default path mapping in main project's tsconfig to point to lib's public_api:

```
"paths": {
      "users": [
        "projects/users/src/public_api"
      ],
      "shared": [
        "projects/shared/src/public_api"
      ]
    }
```
now the libraries are built by `ng serve` command, changes propagates super fast and also the Chrome devtools are able to debug raw typescript files.
Sounds too good to be true but really works.

_Originally posted by @GeorgeKnap in https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/10643#issuecomment-423935700_

**How to use one library project with another**

After this changes how to resolve dependency if "shared" library is used inside "users" library.

Getting below error while `ng build users`

`error TS6059: File '....projects/shared/src/lib/com-model.component.ts' is not under 'rootDir' '...\projects\users\src'. 'rootDir' is expected to contain all source files. 
`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "I've been using the `ng build my-lib --watch` for some time now but I 've been unhappy  with the rebuild time." (#17801)

Issues.Title: bug (cdk/drag-drop): Can't add Theme style '.cdk-drag-preview'
Issues.Body:
- The theme class is set on the app-component which is the first (and only) element of the `body`.
- When executing drag-and-drop the dragged element (with the class `.cdk-drag-preview`) is attached to the body.

Due to this the `.cdk-drag-preview` isn't controlled by themes system.

This bug was already reported twice see:
1. https://github.com/angular/components/issues/17089
2. https://github.com/angular/components/pull/17304

The first bug was resolved with a workaround - Set the theme class directly on the body, not on the app-component.
The 2nd bug was resolved with some code change by the material team.

However I'm still getting this problem. Can someone tell me how to fix this?? (putting the theme selector on the body will not work for me)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug (cdk/drag-drop): Can't add Theme style '.cdk-drag-preview'" (#19494)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): placeholder element not available in started event
Issues.Body:
Fixes calling `CdkDrag.getPlaceholderElement` returning undefined if it's called in the `cdkDragStarted` event.

Fixes #19457.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-drop): placeholder element not available in started event" (#19493)

Issues.Title: Dialog: not possible to scroll content with arrow keys
Issues.Body:
## Bug, enhancement request, or proposal

Bug

# Demo and steps to reproduce the issue

**Demo URL (required)***:  https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-13nutg?file=src/app/dialog-overview-example-dialog.html

#### Detailed Reproduction Steps
1. Add more content in the dialog to make content bigger than the viewport
2. Try to scroll the content using up and down arrows

### Explain the expected behavior
The content of the dialog is scrolled

### Explain the current behavior
Content of the dialog is not scrolled

### Discuss the use-case or motivation for changing the existing behavior
This causes an issue for accessibility as keyboard only users cannot access the full content by scrolling

### List the affected versions of AngularJS, Material, OS, and browsers
- Angular Material 8.2.3
- Browsers: Chrome 81.0.4044.138

#### Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5523926/83165261-8b2f4880-a10d-11ea-9a59-5d044dba713c.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Dialog: not possible to scroll content with arrow keys" (#19479)

Issues.Title: virtual scroll does not drag-n-drop
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-7nkwxb?file=src/app/example-component.ts

#### Expected Behavior
I want to it works with drag-n-drop action whenever and whatever I scroll it.

#### Actual Behavior
When I drag and drop it after scrolling somewhere, It doesn't work.
It changes other postion.
I am sure that previousIndex and currentIndex are wrong in drop event.

#### Environment
- Angular: 9
- CDK/Material:

Issues.Title: help(mat-icon): Failing HTTP requests on registered SVG icons that are served through CDN
Issues.Body:
#### What are you trying to do?

I'm trying to fetch SVG files, that are set in the MatIconRegistry,  from CDN. While most of the assets, that are set in the icon registry are fetched successfully, some randomly fail.

The CORS policy is set, on the AWS bucket that serves my assets through CDN, and allows all `GET` requests. All assets there (js, fonts, images. etc.) are served successfully.

Also this is how the SVG files are registered in my app:
```
this.matIconRegistry.addSvgIcon(
  'houseGray', this.domSanitizer.bypassSecurityTrustResourceUrl(require('../../../assets/img/regular/house--shuttle-gray.svg'))
);
```
##### Note: I use `require()` because I want the asset path to be prefixed with the `deploy-url` when I build for production.

While most of the assets are fetched successfully, sometimes, some fail due to CORS. I noticed that the requests that fail, are missing the HTTP method in the request and I was wondering how this can be possible.

This is a successful request:
```
Request URL: https://my-staging-cdn.s3.amazonaws.com/admin/9e8ed37372ddebdad28dc758d0422fd1682cd47c/house--shuttle-gray.70463f6a5833405a53d8.svg
Request Method: GET
Status Code: 200 OK
Remote Address: 52.216.114.35:443
Referrer Policy: no-referrer-when-downgrade
```
This is an unsuccessful request that leads to CORS error:
```
Request URL: https://my-staging-cdn.s3.amazonaws.com/admin/9e8ed37372ddebdad28dc758d0422fd1682cd47c/house--shuttle-gray.70463f6a5833405a53d8.svg
Referrer Policy: no-referrer-when-downgrade
```
Note, that on the latter, the HTTP request method is missing.

This behavior even happens with (non-cached) assets that were previously fetched successfully (like my example). Seems like that this behavior is a little random, regarding which assets are affected and when.

What's noteworthy is that this happens on Chromium based browser and Safari, but not with Firefox (all at their latest version at the time of writing)

Since the HTTP request is handled by the MatIconRegistry, I was hoping you got an idea on what's going on here and if it's possible for a request to be missing the HTTP request method.

#### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

- Tried to change the path of the asset
- Allowed all HTTP methods on my CORS policy
- Checked that the file exists on my CDN
- Checked the validity of the code of the SVG file
- Fetched the SVG file alone with a `GET` request from the same address that was failiing
- Changed the target of my build in `tsconfig` from `es5` to `es6` hoping that the request will be created in some other way

#### Reproduction

Unfortunately, I can't provide my environment for testing on the issue, because the bucket belongs to a company and it accepts requests from specific origins

Steps to reproduce:
1. Register svg files in the MatIconRegistry
2. Use `require()` to set the file path
3. Set a `deploy-url` to a different origin and allow GET requests in CORS policy
4. Use a Chromium based browser
  
#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2
- CDK/Material: 8.2
- Browser(s): Chromium based browsers and Safari
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Arch, Ubuntu, macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "help(mat-icon): Failing HTTP requests on registered SVG icons that are served through CDN" (#19489)

Issues.Title: bug(Overlay): When attaching an overlay to the DOM, the whole page flickers
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction
Steps to reproduce:
1. create an ng-template with cdkPortal directive
2.  create an OverlayRef with Overlay
3. attach the template ref (CdkPortal) to the OverlayRef

#### Expected Behavior

When I call this sequence of actions I expect to see a modal without causing the page to flicker.

#### Actual Behavior
for a fraction of a second all texts are invisible on the page 
which creates and effect of flickering, the texts are there in the DOM, but not visible
then the PortalOverlay is shown. This happens only the first time I open a CDKPortal
Subsequent call do not provoke this issue.
Looking at the page source initially the cdk-overlay-container is not present in the DOM, it stays there after I close the "modal". Happens the same with MatDialog
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/299973/83165089-b453d700-a115-11ea-910a-3ea92f3dce2b.png)
Digging deeper 
```
createEmbeddedView(templateRef, context, index) {
                /** @type {?} */
               -> const viewRef = templateRef.createEmbeddedView(context || (/** @type {?} */ ({})));
                this.insert(viewRef, index);
                return viewRef;
            }
```
this line cause the whole texts to disappear.
At this moment all texts are invisible.
Further researching and creating base templateRef with a an ng-container as ViewContainerRef, the insert method cause the whole app to flicker.
So this must be a bug in Angular

#### Environment

- Angular: 9.1.9
- CDK/Material: 9.2.4
- Browser(s): Chrome latest
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(Overlay): When attaching an overlay to the DOM, the whole page flickers" (#19476)

Issues.Title: bug(checkbox): `aria-label` and `aria-labelledby` result in duplicate attributes and verbose screen reader experience
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

1. Use NVDA 2020 and Chrome 81
2. Navigate to https://angular-kjejjn-2lxw6j.stackblitz.io
3. Tab to the second example "two labels"

5. Inspect the rendered DOM and observe that `aria-labelledby` is on both the `<mat-checkbox>` and `<input type="checkbox>`.

Issues.Title: docs-bug([FocusTrap]): [Leak documentation about cdkTrapFocusAutoCapture]
Issues.Body:
#### Documentation Feedback

there is a directive called cdkFocusInitial, which is used to focus an initial element, with FocusTrap directive, but the missing point is that if you don't add cdkTrapFocusAutoCapture=true to the FocusTraped element, cdkFocusInitial directive will not work, currently, there is no documentation about that (see  https://material.angular.io/cdk/a11y/overview#regions )
so it would be nice if we could add this kind of info.
we could add it before the example starts: (Remember to use cdkTrapFocusAutoCapture on cdkTrapFocus, for cdkFocusInitial to work)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug([FocusTrap]): [Leak documentation about cdkTrapFocusAutoCapture]" (#19475)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(datepicker): Date range picker validation errors
Issues.Body:
#### Documentation Feedback
Displaying validation errors for date range picker is really obscure. Filter error can be applied for both start and end control (not once), however min is only for start, and max is only for end. This should be documented, because figure it out by yourself is quite confusing.
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-mat-date-range-picker-validation

**Affected documentation page:** https://next.material.angular.io/components/datepicker/overview
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(datepicker): Date range picker validation errors" (#19474)

Issues.Title: fr(google-maps): add forRoot() for global initializing
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

like many modules already use it, it would be nice if you could initialize the Google Map with the method `forRoot()` in `app.module.ts` with given parameters.

#### Use Case

initialize with parameters like:

- apiKey (link apiKey from environment.ts)
- language
- region
- styles (set global styles for map and marker)

These are the first ones I thought of. I'm sure there are many [more](https://angular-maps.com/api-docs/agm-core/interfaces/lazymapsapiloaderconfigliteral#info).

Issues.Title: fr(MatSelectHarness): more options for SelectHarnessFilters
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

At the moment the MatSelectHarness can only be retrieved by selector. It would be helpful if other options were available such as label, placeholder, text, or form control name.

#### Use Case

Solely relying on selectors to get MatSelectHarness requires the templates to be designed in a specific way, for instance with custom attributes - this feature would make developers' lives easier by avoiding that requirement. Other harnesses such as MatInputHarness allow getting the harness according to placeholder and value text. So it seems logical to expect that the MatSelectHarness would also offer this convenience.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "fr(MatSelectHarness): more options for SelectHarnessFilters" (#19471)

Issues.Title: fr(MatSelectHarness): Allow clicking/getting options by value instead of label
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Allow clicking and getting options from MatSelectHarness by value instead of label.

#### Use Case

In our application the labels for selects may change due to requirements changing over time, but the values don't. Therefore it would be more helpful for the OptionHarnessFilters to allow filtering by value than by text.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "fr(MatSelectHarness): Allow clicking/getting options by value instead of label" (#19470)

Issues.Title: bug(MatProgressSpinner): Small Spinners with diameter <= 10 don’t show

Issues.Title: bug(MatSelectHarness): getOptions() returns results from another harness
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/fork/components-issue

Steps to reproduce:
1. Add two mat-selects with the same selector (e.g. id="test") but different ancestor selectors to a page. Both should be multiple-selects. Add 3 options in the first select and no options in the second.
2. Write code that sets options of second select whenever selection within first select changes, so that the second select always contains only the options that are selected in the first select.
3. Use test harness to click one option in first select, then use following code on the second test harness to check that only the single option is available:

```ts
    await select.open();
    const optionLabels = Promise.all((await select.getOptions()).map(option => option.getText()));
```
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?

- There should only be one option in the second select.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?

- The options returned by the second select are the same as in the first - i.e. 3 options - even though when inspecting the component instance, I have verified that the options are correct (just one option).

#### Environment

- Angular: 9.1.7
- CDK/Material: 9.2.3
- Browser(s): Chrome v80
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS 10.15
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatSelectHarness): getOptions() returns results from another harness" (#19468)

Issues.Title: bug([MatCheckbox]): MatCheckbox doesn't check on mobile in certain conditions
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Resubmitting  #17146, as noted on that issue.

I am not able to reproduce this on stackblitz, only in my current project.

When the viewing the page in mobile, clicking on the checkboxes causes the ripple effect on the background but does not check the checkbox. The regular html checkbox below it is able to be checked just fine.

Inspection of the event is showing that the event.isTrusted = false. I think that is the issue, but have no idea how it is happening.

To see the issue on a mobile device:
1. Open [https://test.aryv.com/checkbox-test](https://test.aryv.com/checkbox-test) or [https://aryv.com/checkbox-test](https://aryv.com/checkbox-test) (US only)
2. Click on the checkbox

To see the issue on Windows Chrome:
1. Open dev tools and set the tab to a mobile device.
2. Open [https://test.aryv.com/checkbox-test](https://test.aryv.com/checkbox-test) or [https://aryv.com/checkbox-test](https://aryv.com/checkbox-test) (US only) The tab must be in a mobile view before loading the page to see the issue or you can reload the page after setting it to mobile view.
3. Click the checkbox
 
#### Expected Behavior

The checkbox should be checked.


#### Actual Behavior

The ripple effect displays but the checkbox is not checked.


#### Environment

Since the last report, our project has been upgraded to v9.

- Angular: 7.2.8, 8.2.7, 9.1.0
- CDK/Material: 7.2, 8.2, 9.2
- Browser(s): Chrome, iOS Safari
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows, Android, iOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug([MatCheckbox]): MatCheckbox doesn't check on mobile in certain conditions" (#19466)
